recipe.title: Sour Cream Donuts

steps.step: Cream the butter and sugar together until light.
Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth.
Sift together the dry ingredients and add to the wet mixture. Mix until it forms a soft dough and comes together smoothly.
Add enough shortening to a pan or fryer to cover the donuts when melted (about 5 cm deep). Heat to 325.
Turn dough onto a heavily floured surface. Flour the top well and work together to a smooth ball.
Roll out to 1.5 cm thick. Cut with a donut cutter, and set the pieces aside a few minutes. Re-roll the scraps and cut until all the dough is used.
Deep fry in shortening until brown, about 3 minutes. Donuts will sink to the bottom and crack on top. When they float, they are done.
Remove to a wire rack set over a drip tray. Let cool while frying the remainder.

recipe.serving: Cool and cover on both sides with confectioner's sugar glaze.
recipe.storage: Donuts don't store well, but can be frozen. Freeze the day they are made. Allow to thaw uncovered at room temperature.
